TEXT.citation: Early, R. J., & Whitehorn, J. (2003). One hundred Paiwan texts. Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University.
TEXT.BibTeX_citation: @book{100paiwantexts, author = {Robert Early and John Whitehorn}, title = {One Hundred Paiwan Texts}, year = {2003}, publisher = {Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University}}

S.FORM: qai a siningelitan, sinsi.
qai a siningelitan, sinsi.
S.TRANSL: How we miss you, teacher.

S.FORM: aitsu tsuatsuay anga sun aravats a su vinaikan imaza i Tayuang.
aico coacoay anga son aravac a so vinaikan imaza i Tayoang.
S.TRANSL: It is now a very long time since you left Taiwan.

S.FORM: tiamen singelitan amen aravats, talimuzamuzaw amen sakamaya tjanusun.
tiamen singelitan amen aravac, talimozamozaw amen sakamaya tjanoson.
S.TRANSL: We miss you very much and just feel sad about you.

S.FORM: aki kemudakuda ti sinsi, aki kisamułamuła, aki napupitsul, ayaya men sakamaya.
aki kemodakoda ti sinsi, aki kisamoljamolja, aki napopicol, ayaya men sakamaya.
S.TRANSL: What is the teacher doing, is he working hard, is he well?, we keep saying.

S.FORM: łakua nu nia kinemnemen kudain a pinazazekazekatj timadju nua Tsemas tu mana uri kiqutjela tjanuitjen a imaza i Tayuang a katsalisian numa.
ljakoa no nia kinemnemen kodain a pinazazekazekatj timadjo noa Cemas to mana ori kiqotjela tjanoitjen a imaza i Tayoang a kacalisian noma.
S.TRANSL: But when we think about it, he was ordered by God wasn’t he to be active for us mountain people here in Taiwan.

S.FORM: pai tutsu i tsadja timadju tjanuitjen, łakua ventsivetsik anan uta, kitulutulu anan uta tua kai nua Tsemas tua siłaluayan a pasemalaw tjanuitjen a kematsalisianan uta tua kai nua Tsemas, nu aya men uta masasa men uta.

pai toco i cadja timadjo tjanoitjen, ljakoa vencivecik anan ota, kitolotolo anan ota toa kai noa Cemas toa siljaloayan a pasemalaw tjanoitjen a kemacalisianan ota toa kai noa Cemas, no aya men ota masasa men ota.
S.TRANSL: Now he is far away from us, but he is still studying, he is still learning about the word of God so as to be able to tell us clearly in the mountain language the word of God; when we think of this we are comforted.

S.FORM: pai aitsu titjen a tsautsau a mapułat tjara pinazazekazekatj itjen nua Tsemas tua uri tja sengsengan tusa tja kinaikatsauanan, tua mana uri tja djalan, tu uri pasainu itjen.
pai aico titjen a caocao a mapoljat tjara pinazazekazekatj itjen noa Cemas toa ori tja sengsengan tosa tja kinaikacaoanan, toa mana ori tja djalan, to ori pasaino itjen.
S.TRANSL: Well all we human beings get our orders from God about our work in our life, the way we should go, where we should go to.

S.FORM: qau pai tisun a ti sinsi kudain a pinazazekazekatj anga sun nua Tsemas tua sema maza i Tayuang a hunyaku tua nia kai a Payuang zuku.
qao pai tison a ti sinsi kodain a pinazazekazekatj anga son noa Cemas toa sema maza i Tayoang a honyako toa nia kai a Payoang zoko.
S.TRANSL: And you, teacher, you have been ordered by God haven’t you to come to Taiwan to translate into our language of the Paiwan tribe.

S.FORM: tjara kipaqeneqenetji amen sakamaya.
tjara kipaqeneqenetji amen sakamaya.
S.TRANSL: Just remember us.

S.FORM: pai nu i gaku sun tjara liaw aravats a su siselapay a su sikalułay nua su qulu nua su kininemneman na su kinatsautsauan tua su kisamuła.
pai no i gako son tjara liaw aravac a so siselapay a so sikaloljay noa so qolo noa so kininemneman na so kinacaocaoan toa so kisamolja.
S.TRANSL: When you are in the school you will have a lot to put up with, you will be tired in your head, your thinking and your body because of working hard;

S.FORM: łakua nuka ki sun a namalułalułay aravats, nuka ki sun a namazeli aravats, ui ḍi, ua ku tazua i Tayuang a ku sengsengan a ku qinadju a liaw aravats a tjakałavałava tjanuaken a namapalingzał a namaparutsunuq anan, aya-u uta a kinemnem, sa su kipapupitsupitsul sa su kiqaung uta tua Tsemas.

ljakoa noka ki son a namaloljaloljay aravac, noka ki son a namazeli aravac, oi dri, oa ko tazoa i Tayoang a ko sengsengan a ko qinadjo a liaw aravac a tjakaljavaljava tjanoaken a namapalingzalj a namaparoconoq anan, aya-o ota a kinemnem, sa so kipapopicopicol sa so kiqaong ota toa Cemas.
S.TRANSL: but even if you are very weak, even if you are very tired, think like this: Yes, there is in Taiwan a lot of work that I left that is waiting for me that is incomplete(?) and still in a muddle; and so get more strength and pray to God.

S.FORM: pai tiamen uta aitsu a ḍusa tsavił a uri su vinaikan, palamu ki mangtjez, aya men.
pai tiamen ota aico a drosa cavilj a ori so vinaikan, palamo ki mangtjez, aya men.
S.TRANSL: We too during these two years of your absence, we’ll say: He’ll soon come back.

S.FORM: inika nia linaḍuq a kinemnem.
inika nia linadroq a kinemnem.
S.TRANSL: We haven’t made it longer in our thinking.

S.FORM: kiqauqaung amen uta tua su sipupitsulan, tua su sikitsepelivan anan a sema Tayuang, tua su siqatsuvungan tua su sengsengan, tua mana uri nia sikełangan anga tua kai nua Tsemas uta a łemaluay.
kiqaoqaong amen ota toa so sipopicolan, toa so sikicepelivan anan a sema Tayoang, toa so siqacovongan toa so sengsengan, toa mana ori nia sikeljangan anga toa kai noa Cemas ota a ljemaloay.
S.TRANSL: And we pray too that you will be well, that you will return to Taiwan, that you will finish your work which will result in our understanding the word of God clearly.

S.FORM: qau saka aitsu uła sun a napupitsupitsul a palalaut, uła sun a kinizangan uta na Tsemas, ainu ki nu kisamułamuła sun a ventsik uła sun a papuquluquluin nua Tsemas ta su kełangen a kirimu tua kai nua Tsemas.

qao saka aico olja son a napopicopicol a palalaot, olja son a kinizangan ota na Cemas, aino ki no kisamoljamolja son a vencik olja son a papoqoloqoloin noa Cemas ta so keljangen a kirimo toa kai noa Cemas.
S.TRANSL: And now may you be well always, may you be guarded by God. When you are studying hard may God make you clever so that you quickly understand the word of God.

S.FORM: pai nu tjaivilił anga vetsivetsikan amen uta tua su tigami tuki sun a kemudakudanga tuki sun a paqenetj anan ta nia kai a kinatsalisianan.
pai no tjaivililj anga vecivecikan amen ota toa so tigami toki son a kemodakodanga toki son a paqenetj anan ta nia kai a kinacalisianan.
S.TRANSL: And in the future write us letters to tell us what you are doing and whether you still remember our mountain language.

S.FORM: qau aitsu nu tjaivilił anga kitjen a metsevutsevung anan uta.
qao aico no tjaivililj anga kitjen a mecevocevong anan ota.
S.TRANSL: And in the future we will all meet again.

S.FORM: tiamen namalevaleva men namapuzangal amen tua tja metsevutsevung nu tjaivilił.
tiamen namalevaleva men namapozangal amen toa tja mecevocevong no tjaivililj.
S.TRANSL: We are glad and hope for our meeting again in the future.

S.FORM: uła tjen a laḍuq anan a tja nasi, uła tjen a nasetsevung anan tjai sinsi, uła tjen a anan a kisamuła tua patjara Tsemas, nakidjadjalan ayaya men uta a kiqauqaung tua Tsemas.
olja tjen a ladroq anan a tja nasi, olja tjen a nasecevong anan tjai sinsi, olja tjen a anan a kisamolja toa patjara Cemas, nakidjadjalan ayaya men ota a kiqaoqaong toa Cemas.
S.TRANSL: May our lives be long, so that we’ll meet the teacher again, so that we can join in working for God, is what we say in prayer to God.

S.FORM: saka kimen a napupitsupitsul uta, kimen a kiqaung tjanusun.
saka kimen a napopicopicol ota, kimen a kiqaong tjanoson.
S.TRANSL: May we be well and we’ll pray for you.

S.FORM: tisun uta ki sun a napupitsupitsul uta sa su kiqauqaungan amen uta.
tison ota ki son a napopicopicol ota sa so kiqaoqaongan amen ota.
S.TRANSL: And you too may you be well and pray for us too.

S.FORM: namatsatsadjatsadja itjen, łakua kitjen a namateveteveł i tjaiqayaw tua Tsemas, kitjen a tjara natjadjaladjalan sakamaya.
namacacadjacadja itjen, ljakoa kitjen a namatevetevelj i tjaiqayaw toa Cemas, kitjen a tjara natjadjaladjalan sakamaya.
S.TRANSL: We are far apart, but we’ll be together before God and we’ll be united(?).

S.FORM: saka aitsu uri amin anga nua ku kai.
saka aico ori amin anga noa ko kai.
S.TRANSL: And now this will be the end of my speech.

S.FORM: pakakiqauqaungi a palalaut a pasa tua Tsemas tua tja siselapay.
pakakiqaoqaongi a palalaot a pasa toa Cemas toa tja siselapay.
S.TRANSL: Let us pray for one another always to God in our troubles.
